attributes.action: LEARN ABOUT BLACK HISTORY IN UK SCHOOLS.
attributes.additional_details: With the black lives matter movement, it had come to my attention that many people are learning more about black and racist history through social media. This is not good enough. We need to educate our children on our past so we can improve our future and become closer to an anti-racist society. We need to change the way we show people our history.
attributes.background: Change the history curriculum in the UK to include Britain’s colonialism, slavery and treatment of black people and other people of colour.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
